entry.title: Advanced Intercompany Process - Update Sales Order from Purchase Order
entry.content:
Hi,

In the advanced intercompany process, when sales order is created, automatically purchase order is created. We want to update the original sales order when purchase order is saved. How to find the link between the purchase order and the sales order in BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST ~ POST. There is no information in the account assignment ( mepoaccounting). Also VBFA is updated once the purchase order is completely saved but we need the information during save in the POST method.

Thanks a lot in advance for your inputs!

Plamen

Shelly Group

entry.title: SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest for creating a product with classification
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We need to create products with related classifications and characteristics via API in S/4 Hana Cloud Public. For with purpose we use standard SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest ( https://api.sap.com/api/PRODUCTMDMBULKREPLICATEREQUEST/overview ). 

But we have a problem: when we're consuming the web service from ABAP Environment ( from custom class from Eclipse ), we get errors  in SOAP Log Message:

 

Log Messages

 
Consumer:
  • Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transact
  • soap-env : http://schemas.xmlsoap. org/soap/envelope/
  • faultcode : soap-env:Server
  • faultstring : Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transa ... Show More
  • lang : en
     
    Provider:
    SRT: Plain SOAP: Reliable messaging (RM) configured, but consumer sends QoS BE request.
     We are trying to call the SOAP web service within SAP: Source and Target both are S4 HANA public cloud system.

 

Here are our actions step-by-step:

1. Created a Communication User in the Maintain Communication Users app  in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition.

2. Created a communication system in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition and added as inbound communication user created in step 1

3.  Created a communication arrangement based on the communication scenario SAP_COM_0009. Deactivate all Outbound Services. And then downloaded WSDL file of Product Master - Replicate from Client to SAP S/4HANA Cloud

4. Created in ADT a service consumption model for the targeted web service from the metadata file from step 3.

5. Created in ADT  an outbound service.

6. Created in ADT  a communication scenario and assign the outbound service to it. Chose the Authentication Methods Basic and X.509.

7.  Then in Communication Arrangements app created another communication arrangement based on our custom communication scenario, as well as a new communication system and an outbound communication user from step 1.

8.  Checked connection: we get "The ping of the outbound service was successful".

9. For the implementation of the outbound call, we used the code sample copied earlier from the service consumption model

I would really appreciate any help. Many thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: Re: New Entries Not Available on Assign Warehouse Door
entry.content:
Hi Charisma,

here is the answer:

The creation of doors is described in

SAP Signavio Process Navigator/

Solution Scenario/

SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Solution Process

Warehouse Inbound Processing (3BR)

Set-Up Instructions

Define Warehouse Door.

https://pr.alm.me.sap.com/launchpad#processnavigator-display&/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2508/SolP/3BR/?region=DE

 

Door-related steps are covered in solution process Warehouse Outbound Processing (3BS) within the Test script, sections 2.6.3â€“2.6.6:

  - 2.6.3 Create Loading Point (Optional)

  - 2.6.4 Assign Door to Loading Point (Optional)

  - 2.6.5 Staging Area and Door Determination (Outbound)

  - 2.6.6 Access Sequence to Staging Areas and Door Determination

- 3BS (Outbound) test script sections 2.6.3â€“2.6.6

  https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2508/SolP/3BS?region=DE

Hope this helps.

Best regards

Frank

entry.title: RPA Recorder doesnâ€™t detect native file upload popup in Fiori application
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Iâ€™m working on automating a Fiori application using SAP Intelligent RPA / SAP Build Process Automation. There are Input Field (<input type="file">) and a Browse button in the app that triggers a standard file upload dialog from the operating system.

However, during RPA Recording, the recorder cannot detect this native popup. After clicking Browse, the file selection dialog appears, butno action is captured, so the upload step is missing.

What has been tried:

  • Different browsers (Chrome/Edge) -> same behavior
  • Re-running the recording with different UI capture modes
  • Trying to manually interact with the popup

It seems the recorder doesnâ€™t handle native OS dialogs during Web automation.

Questions:

  • What is the recommended approach to handle file upload dialogs in Fiori automation?
  • Is there a known workaround?


Any tips, best practices, or documentation references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks a lot for your help!

entry.title: Building Resilient Enterprises: SAPâ€™s Security Gains from Microsoft Defender for Cloud
entry.content:
By Sven Frank, Cyber Security Architect IAM & Zero Trust (SAP), Martin Pankraz, Principal Product Manager SAP Integration and Security (Microsoft), Amos Wendorff, Cyber Security Data Governance Lead

 

ğŸš¨The 3 PM Friday Security Crisis: Why Human-Centered Security Matters

Picture this: It's 3 PM on a Friday, and your development team just discovered a critical production issue affecting thousands of customers. A major client demo is scheduled for Monday morning, and your lead developer needs to spin up additional Azure resources immediately to implement a hotfix. The standard security approval process typically takes 48 hours.

âš ï¸The Dangerous Moment: In this high-pressure situation, it's tempting to take shortcutsâ€”opening broader network access than necessary, using shared service accounts, or bypassing security scanning protocols. "We'll fix it properly after the crisis," becomes the dangerous refrain that can turn a temporary workaround into a permanent vulnerability.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ The SAP Secure-by-Default Philosophy

At SAP, securing our Microsoft Azure landscapes extends beyond technology alone. We face tight deadlines and pressure to complete projects quickly, which can challenge maintaining strong security practices. That's why our secure-by-default approachâ€”closing unnecessary ports, phasing out legacy authentication, and enforcing automated policies with thorough identity managementâ€”is designed to support everyone in staying secure, even when time is limited.

âš¡Speed AND Security, Not Speed OR Security

When our developer can provision resources through pre-configured, security-hardened templates with just a few clicks, we eliminate the false choice between speed and security. Equally important is fostering a security-conscious mindset throughout our teams, grounded in continuous learning and constructive accountability. Through consistent knowledge-sharing sessions, we ensure alignment across the organization.

ğŸ”—Bridging Security and Architecture: A Real-World Challenge

But here's where it gets more complex. Fast-forward to Monday morningâ€”the crisis is resolved, but now our Enterprise Architecture team discovers something concerning. During the weekend sprint, three different teams independently deployed similar cloud applications to solve related problems. Each believed they were following secure practices, but collectively, they've created an unmanaged sprawl of SaaS applications across our landscape.

The traditional scenario: Our security team knows these applications exist and can assess their individual risk profiles through Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. Meanwhile, our enterprise architects are mapping our application portfolio in SAP LeanIX, trying to understand capability gaps and technology dependencies. In most enterprises, IT security and enterprise architecture are two critical disciplines, each with their own priorities, tools, and perspectives. One is laser-focused on threat detection, compliance, and access control. The other is mapping capabilities, rationalizing applications, and shaping long-term IT strategy.
But what if these two worlds could work together seamlessly?

 

ğŸ¯The Power of Integration: SAP #LeanIX + Microsoft Defender for Cloud App

At SAP, we've implemented an integration between SAP LeanIX and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps that transforms how we approach secure and compliant software usage. With this integration, you can pull application usage and risk data from Defender for Cloud Apps directly into SAP LeanIX. That means: ... You're no longer just identifying what's out there - you're aligning it with your architecture strategy. This turns ad-hoc discovery into intentional governance.

ğŸ”Real-Time Visibility Meets Strategic Planning

Applications are added to Cloud Apps in MS Defender when someone accesses a cloud application through their browser, which could lead to a significant number of discovered applications. This continuous discovery feeds directly into our LeanIX environment, where our enterprise architects can immediately see:

  • Risk-aligned Architecture Decisions: Security risk scores from Defender for Cloud Apps appear alongside capability mappings in LeanIX, enabling architects to make informed decisions about application rationalization
  • Compliance-Driven Portfolio Management: Applications flagged for compliance issues in Defender are automatically highlighted in our architecture views, allowing us to prioritize remediation based on business impact
  • Usage-Based Capability Planning: Real usage data helps identify which applications are truly critical versus those that can be consolidated or retired

ğŸš€From Reactive Discovery to Proactive Governance

This integration fosters collaboration between two personas that often operate in parallel but rarely intersect. With Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and SAP LeanIX, they do - bringing security and architecture into a shared conversation around risk, capability, and value.

Kahoot is an example of an in-house approved application, in the terminology of Defender for Cloud Apps a sanctioned application. This allows the Enterprise Architect to make clear, data-driven decisions when harmonizing tools, eliminating guesswork and ensuring alignment across the organization.

If you want to learn more about LeanIX and Defender for Cloud Apps, have a look here.
This blog post was co-authored by @Michelle10 

 

ğŸŒŠThe Ripple Effect of Integrated Security / Final Part

This comprehensive strategy enables us to effectively protect our environments and maintain the highest security standards across our SAP landscapes in Azure - even when the pressure is on.

Ultimately, our customers and partners benefit directly from these security practices, as they translate into more robust, reliable, and trustworthy SAP solutions. The secure-by-default principles and security-conscious culture that protect our Azure environments become foundational elements when organizations implement our products - creating a ripple effect that strengthens security across the broader ecosystem.

entry.title: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-1
entry.content:
In this blog, Part-1, I will be primarily focusing on SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) through a Supply Chain use case - predicting the forecast delivery date by using regression based predictive model (SAP Standard ISLM Framework). This Model provides predictions based on historical data. I will also touch base on the SAP Situation Handling Scenario for the Stock Transfer Order Process. However, I will walk you through the set-up in more detail in Part-2 of this blog series.

My Business Use Case:

My organization has to transfer an Asset: 20000000 (Equipment: 10000001-Air Compressor 1250 CFM 8KG/CM2) from our Norco Plant in Louisiana to our Robinson Plant in Illinois. To support this process and predict the forecast delivery date based on historical stock transfers, we have activated the ISLM Scenario: MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT (Stock In Transit Material Overdue) and a  Situation Handling Scenario: MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN (Stock Transport Order Overdue) to monitor exceptions as well.

Let us dive in...

What Is ISLM: Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management is a standardized framework to build and manage AI use cases within SAP S/4HANA for both embedded and side-by-side scenarios. It can be leveraged to perform lifecycle operations, including Scheduled Training and Retraining, and deployment of the model directly within SAP S/4HANA.

ISLM framework consists of two Fiori Applications, Intelligent Scenarios (App ID F4469) and Intelligent Scenario Management (App ID F4470). These two applications provide a unified interface for creating, deploying,  monitoring, and activation of the model directly within SAP S/4HANA.

Based on the ISLM association with business application, the ISLM scenarios can be categorized as Embedded and Side-by-Side.

Embedded: A business application, for example SAP S/4HANA runs in the same stack as its machine learning provider with the analytics libraries SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library (APL) or SAP HANA Predictive Analysis Library (PAL).

 Side-by-Side: A business application, for example SAP S/4HANA runs in a separate stack than its machine learning infrastructure provider.

 To begin with, let us take a look at the architecture of SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management.

Architecture of Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management

  • Business User: The user who Interacts with the business application and uses the predictions from machine learning for the business purpose.
  • Business Administrator: A domain expert who can perform model trainings based on business context, evaluate model quality , and activate a model for production usage.
  • Technical Administrator: A system administrator who can perform the configurations of connectivity between different entities and maintains the technical configurations of the system.
  • ABAP Developer: A developer who can create ABAP artifacts required for Intelligent Scenario registration.
  • Intelligent Scenario Owner: An owner who creates, reviews, and publishes the Intelligent Scenario.

For instance, based on our business use case, I will walk you through the standard ISLM scenario that leverages one of the models from SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library (APL) by stepping into the roles of "Business User", "Business Administrator", and "Intelligent Scenario Owner".

The Intelligent Scenarios App is used to create, display, and configure various scenarios tailored to specific business needs. Using this App, we can view a list and activate SAP provided standard scenarios or create Embedded or Side-by-Side scenarios. 

Now, let us use the SAP provided ISLM scenario "MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT" and take a look at the input and out put fields used by the model, and Fiori App IDs that support the business process.

The Input fields are the data points to train an ML model and to make new prediction. They represent the historical business data and other relevant information that the ML model can learn from to identify the patterns.

Output fields contain the results generated by the ML model after it is trained. These output fields provide the predictions and related metrics back to the business application.

It`s time to publish the scenario...

After successfully publishing the ISLM scenario, let us move on to the "Intelligent Scenario Management" application to  train the model and schedule it.

The Intelligent Scenario Management App is used to manage, monitor,  and optimize AI driven scenarios throughout their entire lifecycle. We can view the list of App IDs relevant for the ISLM scenario MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT.

For instance, let us retrain the model with new historical data using new filtering conditions. The system generates a new Model Version ID for every "Retrain".

Following the successful training, the system provides a statistical information on variables and performance of the model. The model version report screen provides a summary about a particular model version. The quality information details varies according to the intelligent scenario type and underlying machine learning used.

For Instance, the following filter values are used for training the model.

The tab "Debrief" in a "Model Version Report" provides a breakdown of the trained machine learning model`s characteristics and its key influencing factors. The "Debrief" helps us understand and evaluate the model by explaining the main drivers behind its prediction.

Key Influencers and their percentage of contribution in the overall prediction.

We can schedule a training for our Intelligent Scenarios. When the schedule is created for a training, the system creates a planned task, which can be viewed in "Scheduled Planned Task" tab.

Mini Note: If we try to create a new schedule without deactivating the previous one, the system prompts an error message.

We can monitor the scheduled runs that are created via ISLM in the "Monitor Planned Task Jobs" tile.

We can copy and cancel the planned task and view the logs associated with each run of the schedule.

Now, let us move on to "Situation Handling Scenarios"...

As part of our business use case, I have activated the situation handling scenario with the following conditions: "MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN" to notify respective business team if the the order gets delayed.

Situation Handling Scenario: ZMAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN conditions to trigger an exception message.

Situation Handling Conditions to trigger an exception notification...

Following the successful activation and training of ISLM and Situation Handling Scenarios, let us examine the transactional data.

Norco Plant asset/equipment master:

We have Asset Master and Equipment Master synchronization functionality in place. 

Following the successful movement of equipment 10000001 from its functional location to Engineering Spares Warehouse, the system updates the stock in the designated storage location, which should be transferred to the Robinson Plant.  The stock movement has been completed using a Maintenance Order.

Now, let us create a Stock Transfer Order using App ID F1957 - Transfer Stock Cross - Plant

With this App, we can make transfer postings from one plant(Issuing Plant) to another plant(Receiving Plant). This app supports warehouse clerk in finding the allowed transfer postings  and in personalizing the control settings of storage locations and visible columns.

For instance, I have chosen the material code "271", which is designated for Equipment 10000001.

Mini Note: If the predictive analytics model is active, the system uses the predicted delivery date as forecast delivery date. We can also select the entry "Use Predictive Model for Forecast Delivery Date" in the application settings.

I have chosen the storage location 171B , which contains the stock of Equipment 10000001. I have entered the input values in the pop-up screen. The activated ISLM scenario model determines the "Forecast Delivery Date" for the stock transfer order based on the historical data.

Now, let us create "Stock Transport Order" using the option "Create Stock Transport Order".

Following the successful creation of stock transport order,  using App ID F2139: Overdue Materials - Stock In Transit, we can view the "Predicted Deviation" values for the stock transport orders.

Using this App F2139 (Overdue Materials-Stock In Transit) with an Active Predictive Model:

  • If the predictive analytical model is active, the system uses the predicted delivery date as forecast delivery date.
  • If the predictive analytics model is active, we can select the "Predicted Deviation" field in the view settings for the results list.

Mini Note: The predicted deviation field displays the difference between the planned and the predicted delivery date. With this information about the predicted deviation, we get an impression that if a goods receipt can be successfully completed in time.

How to Interpret the predicted Deviation field value:

  • In our case, the predicted deviation for the STO 4500000334 is negative, i.e., -1  : This means that the forecast delivery date calculated by the predictive model is one day later than the planned delivery date from the purchase order.
  • If the predicted deviation is 0 (Zero) : This means that the forecast delivery date and the planned delivery date from the purchase order are the same.
  • If the predicted deviation is positive, for example 2 : This means that the forecast delivery date calculated by the predictive model is two days ahead of the planned delivery date from the purchase order.

Using this App F2139 (Overdue Materials-Stock In Transit) without an Active Predictive Model: 

  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, we cannot select the "Predicted Deviation" field in the view settings for the results list.
  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, the micro chart uses the planned delivery date from the purchase order instead.
  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, the forecast delivery date and the planned delivery date of the purchase order are the same.

The shipping duration micro chart illustrates the goods movement process for an Stock Transfer Order item and shows the forecast delivery date in relation to the actual delivery date. 

Since we have activated the "Situation Handling Scenario" with the conditions, the system triggers the exception notification when the stock in transit days are >1.

In our use case, the STO 4500000334 was delayed and met the conditions that are part of situation handling scenario; hence, the system triggered the exception notification.

The situations are displayed at "Bell Icon", which is a gate way to the SAP Fiori notification center.

or we can use "App ID: F4154 (My Situations app) " to monitor exception notifications.

Following the successful completion of the STO 4500000334, the situation can be closed using thee option "Close Situations" in My Situations App.

ğŸ˜Š This brings me to the end of a detailed walkthrough of the SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management process , along with a high-level overview on how the situation handling scenario supports business teams in monitoring exceptions. I hope this blog proves useful to the Inventory Management team to have a nuanced understanding of material movements with enhanced predictive insights and exception notifications during Stock Transfer Order Process.

A detailed walkthrough of the SAP Situation Handling scenario process flow is covered in Part-2 of this blog series...use the link below to view it.

S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-2 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy. C

entry.title: Configuring Employer Compliance Task for WTPA Forms
entry.content:
With the 2H 2025 release, SAP SuccessFactors is enhancing the Compliance framework with a new capability â€” Employer Compliance Task â€” designed to streamline how employee pay-specific compliance forms such as Wage Theft Prevention Act (WTPA) are handled during the onboarding process.

In the current (legacy) implementation, partners and customers are required to configure field-level override mappings and business rules for every individual form field. This not only increases setup effort but also requires ongoing maintenance whenever statutory formats evolve.

The newly introduced Employer Compliance Task significantly simplifies this process. It allows the employer or designated responsible user to directly enter employee-specific pay details inside the compliance form, as part of the standard onboarding flow â€” eliminating the need for most manual override configurations.

This enhancement is initially available for:

  • ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸WTPA New York and California forms

  • ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³India EPF Declaration Form

  • ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦Canada TD1 Form

This blog provides implementation-focused guidance for implementation partners and SAP SuccessFactors consultants, covering feature activation, configuration steps, functional behavior changes, and flow comparison with the previous approach.

Prerequisites

  • Onboarding instance updated to 2H 2025 release
  • Compliance Framework enabled
  • WTPA forms (New York and/or California) are licensed and active
  • Admin access to Compliance Settings
  • At least one eligible Manager or Corp Representative user available to act as Employer
  • (Optional but recommended) Global Filter framework configured for assigning WTPA NY vs CA selectively

Why This New Method Is Valuable

Legacy Override Mapping

Employer Compliance Task (New)

Every field mapped manually via field override

Employer directly enters values inside Compliance UI

Business rules required for even simple values

Zero mapping required â€” real-time user entry

No live control for HR before employee signature

Full employer validation first, before employee signs

Risky for fast-changing fields like wage & schedule

Ideal for dynamic compensation fields

Recommendation: If dynamic pay data is employer-known but not stored in EC â†’ use Employer Compliance Task.

Step 1: Enable Employer Compliance Task

Go to:
Admin Center â†’ Compliance Settings â†’ United States â†’ â€œNotice of Pay Rate â€“ Wage Theft Prevention Act (WTPA)â€

  1. Expand the WTPA country group
  2. Click Add Configuration
  3. Enter Name, Description & designate Employer user selection

Enable both checkboxes:

  • âœ…Enable employer compliance task for filling and/or signing the compliance forms
  • âœ…Enable Employer Compliance Task for WTPA Form

Screenshot placeholder:

Eligible Employer Users

You may assign one of the following as Employer (responsible user):

  • Any Manager from Job Relationships (Manager, HR Manager, Second Manager, Matrix Manager, etc.)
  • Corp Representative (external â€” must be resolved through a Business Rule)

Screenshot placeholder:

 

Step 2: Configure Global Filter for Form Assignment

Define which WTPA version (NY or CA) is assigned to which new hire based on legal entity, state, country, etc.

Refer Global FIlter Configuration link, for configuring filter configuration for WTPA form assignment.

Step-by-Step User Experience

Step 1 â€” New Hire Task (No Change)

New hire opens compliance task â†’ selects Language Preference

 

Step 2 â€” Employer Compliance Task (New!)

A new task is created for Employer to fill legally required wage & schedule details directly in the form.

Step 3 â€” New Hire Signature

The generated PDF contains both New Hire and Employer-entered data.
New Hire reviews â†’ signs.

Step 4 â€” Employer Signature (Only for California WTPA)

If WTPA CA â†’ Employer receives one final signature task

 

Key Differences vs Legacy Override Mapping

Aspect

Legacy Field Override

Employer Compliance Task

Configuration Effort

High â€” mapping for each field

Low â€” no mapping needed

Who enters data

System/business rule

Employer in UI

Flexibility

Needs code change for updates

Real-time

CA Employer Signature Support

âŒNo

âœ…Yes

Summary â€” When to Use What

Scenario

Recommended Method

Static data from EC

Legacy Override Mapping

Dynamic pay/schedule admin-controlled

âœ…Employer Compliance Task (recommended)

California legal requirement with employer signature

âœ…Employer Compliance Task only

Closing Note for Partners

This new method significantly reduces implementation complexity and avoids maintenance-heavy field mapping logic â€” especially for high-variance employer-entered wage details.

This Employer Compliance feature is going to be co-exist and supported along with existing fieldOverride mapping option.

entry.title: Objectives in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager â€” Part 1 on Driving Transformation
entry.content:
What is SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

For customers
SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager is the central workspace for planning, steering, and proving the success of enterprise transformation programs. It links business objectives with the initiatives, tasks, and results that deliver them. By combining strategic goals with live process data and benchmarking analytics, it provides a single, transparent view of where change is happening and whether it is working.

For partners
SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager offers an integration and extension layer for partners who help customers design, implement, and monitor transformation programs. Its upcoming APIs will allow partners to connect external project-management systems and data platforms, and analytics tools, enabling automated synchronization of objectives, initiatives, and insights across ecosystems.

Why start with Objectives

When companies say â€œweâ€™re transforming,â€ they often mean â€œweâ€™re busy.â€ Objectives make you ask why youâ€™re busy and how youâ€™ll know it worked. In SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager, an Objective represents a concrete business goal:
â€œReduce order-to-cash cycle by 20%,â€ or â€œImprove on-time delivery to 98%.â€

With the July 2025 release, SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager introduced first-class support for Objectives: you can now create, edit, assign owners, and link them directly to Initiatives, ensuring every action in your program serves a strategic purpose.

Objective Details Panel

How to Use Objectives in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

  1. Define clear, measurable goals â€“ Use SMART criteria. Keep the number manageable (3â€“5 strategic objectives).
  2. Create them in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager â€“ Each objective has title, description, owner, timeline, and status.
  3. Link Initiatives â€“ Every project or program should trace back to at least one objective.
  4. Adapt â€“ Objectives evolve; SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager's structure makes it easy to update and re-align.

Objective Main Area View

Common Pitfalls

  • Too many objectives dilute focus.
  • Vague wording like â€œimprove efficiencyâ€ without targets. 
  • Initiatives launched without objectives â€” thatâ€™s not transformation, thatâ€™s motion.

Why it matters

Objectives are the spine of transformation. They bring clarity, alignment, and accountability. SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager gives you a way to define them once, link everything that happens in your organization to them, and track whether those activities deliver actual value.

Next in the series: Initiatives â€” How to translate your objectives into executable programs with SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager.

entry.title: Where to begin with SAP Requirements in Jira?
entry.content:
I think all of SAP project experts will agree that SAP Requirements Management is much more than an Excel file downloaded from the SAP Activate Roadmap accelerators list and filled with unstructured notes from Fit-2-Standard workshops. In practice, Requirements Management should be the bridge between business intent and tested, working functionality. And yet, this bridge often does not exist. The disconnect between what business processes should do and what finally goes live remains one of the biggest causes of rework and missed value in SAP programs.

Why managing requirements is important?

A weak requirements discipline leads later to solution scope creep, fragmented testing, and the famous â€œthis isnâ€™t what we expectedâ€ moment during the UAT. Well organized requirements management turns conversations into commitments - every requirement becomes traceable from the "Need" through "Realize and Test" to "Deploy". Traceability is the essence of governance in SAP Activate.

High-level business outcomes are defined during Discover and Prepare phase, while detailed functional, non-functional, and delta requirements are refined and documented during the Explore phase. They are documented against SAP Best Practice processes (for example BD9 - Sell from Stock).

Every requirement should be linked to its related Test Case and Work Package to ensure full traceability from Fit-to-Standard through Deployment. This linkage keeps it transparent, testable, and aligned with business value.

How SAP Activate Defines a Requirement

In the Requirements-to-Deploy (R2D) framework, a requirement is a single, testable statement describing the system behavior or capability needed to fulfill a business need.
Each requirement should be:

  • Atomic â€“ one clear need, not a bundle of ideas.

  • Unambiguous â€“ can be interpreted only in one way.

  • Traceable â€“ linked to a Process, Scope Item and Work Package (deliverable).

  • Testable â€“ verifiable through objective criteria.

A requirement is not a meeting note like â€˜Need better reportsâ€™; it states precisely what the system must do. It defines what the system must achieve but not yet how to implement it.

When written in a standardized way, requirements become the shared language between Business and IT - the foundation for alignment, testing, and auditability.

 Practically in Jira

Ok, so if it is now clear what a requirement is and how it should be defined, the next question becomes where to manage all this effectively. Thatâ€™s where Jira - when properly configured - becomes a practical backbone for collecting, tracking, and approving SAP requirements.

In Jira, requirements can be managed as custom Work Item types aligned with SAP Activate governance standards.

  1. Create a dedicated work item type called Requirement with a distinct icon.

  2. Configure essential fields and workflow statuses (e.g., Draft â†’ To Be Approved â†’ Approved â†’ In Realization â†’ Completed).

  3. Link each requirement to its Scope item, ensuring full traceability.

Once configured, you can collect requirements directly in Jira during your Fit-To-Standard workshops.

SAP native tools

While SAP Cloud ALM and Solution Managerâ€™s Focused Build provide strong governance for requirement-to-deploy processes, many organizations still complement them with Jira to enable broader Agile methods delivery, integrate non-SAP workstreams, and leverage its native links with Confluence and Test automation tools. Also, there are a few integration tools available that allow for data exchange between Jira and SAP.

Your Goal

In any SAP project, your goal is to ensure that every piece of delivered and tested functionality traces back to at least one well-written requirement. However, the discipline lies not in the tool itself but in the governance structure and consistency with which itâ€™s used.

If you have found this article informative, please leave me a Kudo on top of this page.
This will encourage me to write more articles in SAP Community. Thank you!

About author

Bogdan GÃ³rka works as Atlassian Solution Architect and SAP Project Governance Consultant.
Creator of R2D ALM for Jira, independent Atlassian consultant, and founder of PMBG.EU.

entry.title: IDOC integration of SAP backends - SAP Cloud Integration (Int. Suite)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have an inbound IDOC interface using SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) .. SOAP to IDOC is the scenario where sender is a web services.. Now, our Basis team is declining to enable SICF on SAP backend and adding "/" path as it is against our organization security hardening guidelines.. We are using Cloud Connector obviously.. below are the steps implemented :-

1. All communication will flow exclusively through the SAP Cloud Connector(SCC) , establishing a secure, avoiding direct internet exposure of the backend. Strict firewall rules maintained to allow only essential communication between the Cloud Connector and the SAP backend. All communication utilizes standard, auditable HTTPS/TLS 1.2+ protocols, securing data transmission end-to-end. The SCC configuration explicitly exposes only the virtual host and the single path: /sap/bc/srt/idoc.

2. Secure ICF Service Activation on SAP Backend : Only the specific /sap/bc/srt/idoc ICF service will be activated, with debugging/tracing disabled in production.. Debugging and tracing features are explicitly disabled on the SICF service in all Production environments.

3. A dedicated, non-dialog user is created with a single-purpose role ..

SAP Support documentation confirms that the use of the '/' value in S_SERVICE does not act as a security wildcard for explicitly defined Web Services. This guarantees that the technical user is strictly contained and cannot execute other general services. Please see below screenshot of email from SAP team regarding the same. Could you please add if anything important is missing here to establish secure architecture? Any chances that our Organization Hardening tam still rejects ?

Regards,

Ramu.

entry.title: What's New in SAP HANA Cockpit SP 18
entry.content:
SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 continues to advance database administration capabilities with enhancements in administration and monitoring, landscape management, advanced administration, and security & user management. The complete list of SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 features is available in the Whatâ€™s New in the SAP HANA Cockpit 2.0 section of the SAP Help Portal. This blog post highlights and demonstrates the key new functionality delivered in this version of the SAP HANA cockpit.

 

Administration and Monitoring

Third Level Partitioning

The release of SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 introduces enhanced partitioning capabilities, allowing tables to be partitioned for up to three levels. Previously, table partitioning was limited to two levels. This new feature offers database administrators greater flexibility to manage large table structures and optimize query performance.

To implement a third level partition, the first two levels need to be set to RANGE to create distinct, non-overlapping segments based on ordered values such as dates and ID numbers. Please note that the third level partitioning is only available for monitored databases with SAP HANA 2.0 version SPS 08 or later.

To facilitate this, the Table Distributions and Table Partitions app have been updated. You can now edit the existing first and second level partition information before adding the third level.

 

Import and Export Configuration Templates

The ability to import and export instance configuration templates between different SAP HANA cockpit environments is now available, providing a simple method to move configuration templates between different SAP HANA cockpit installations. Previously configuration templates could not easily be replicated in a different cockpit environment. The import/export functionality allows administrators to test configuration templates in a test or QA landscape, and once everything works as expected, to easily transport those templates to a production landscape.

In the Configuration Templates app in the Cockpit Manager, upon clicking on export, a .zip file containing the chosen template configurations in a .csv file will be downloaded.

When importing Template configurations, there are three options to choose from depending on your needs and if there are duplicate .

  • Do not import the file: if the uploaded .zip file contains any one duplicate template names, then it will cancel the import action for the entire .zip file
  • Only import templates that are not duplicates: the duplicate templates will be ignored, and it will only import the templates that are not duplicates
  • Import the file, overwrite duplicate templates: overwrite the duplicate templates, always importing the uploaded templates. It will delete the old duplicates and import the new templates.

Below is a screenshot of the options. 

This feature will be useful for database administrators who have a distribution of two separate cockpits for non-production and production SAP HANA databases. Now, you can easily manage the SAP HANA database parameters across the landscapes, streamlining your operations with SAP HANA cockpit SP 18.

Additional Statuses in Database Directory

Additional status filters to the Database directory app have been added for you to easily filter for a specific problem. The â€œRunning with Issuesâ€ status category used to group together several distinct problems, which are now broken down further. This status will be branched into 6 more specific ones, including, â€œInvalid Technical Userâ€, â€œLicense Expiredâ€, â€œNo SQL Accessâ€, â€œSSL Enforcedâ€, â€œTransitioningâ€, and â€œErrorâ€, as shown in the screenshot below.

This product enhancement provides more transparency and visibility, eliminating the troubleshooting process of finding the types of issues impacting each database instance. You can spend less time on diagnosing the root cause and filter for a specific problem to focus on the resolution of the critical issues.

SQL Statement Hints

We are introducing a more flexible and convenient way for you to manage your SQL statements using the Statement Hints app. Now when adding a new statement hint, you will be presented with three options for identifying the target SQL statement. In addition to the previous method of entering the full statement text, you can now directly provide the statements hash.

The new â€œSelect SQL Statementâ€ option allows you to browse or search for previously run SQL statements in the database. You can view the actual SQL text and the statement hash, making it easier for you to locate the exact query to be tuned.

Statement Hints are now more helpful and efficient for database administrators, as these new capabilities allow for expensive SQL statements to more easily be identified and tuned.

 

Native Storage Extension (NSE), Buffer Cache Monitor Unload Threshold Parameter Configuration

Now, there is a more intelligent way to control and manage the SAP HANA Native Storage Extension (NSE) buffer cache. You can configure the unload threshold parameter to be automatically adjusted or still set it to a manual configured value. The automatic adjustment option allows for the system to dynamically calculate the optimal unload threshold value based on your databases workload. It can be configured to be adjusted in specified set time interval which depends on your landscape.

This automatically updating threshold value will be displayed directly on the Buffer Cache size chart for clear visibility.

Previously, the unload threshold was frequently set to the maximum size of the buffer cache based on the initial use of NSE tables. This caused a redundancy when NSE table sizes decrease, where a large amount of memory is being reserved for buffer cache that wonâ€™t be used. Now, the SAP HANA system can be configured to intelligently release unused portions of the buffer cache, translating to a more efficient utilization of the landscape. Note that this feature requires an SAP HANA 2.0 SPS 07 or newer registered database.

 

Native Storage Extension Advisor Configuration Improvements

The SAP HANA Native Storage Extension (NSE) Advisor has been enhanced by allowing its configuration to be changed with using a , called CS_NSE_ADVISOR. Now when opening the NSE Advisor configuration, a check occurs if the CS_NSE_ADVISOR procedure is running in the background. If it isnâ€™t, you will be able to fill in the parameters in the config page. Below is a screenshot of the built-in procedure running with the parameters filled in.

Secondly there is now a way to automatically apply advice mode rules within the NSE Advisor config page, such as changing objects from cold column partitions to page loadable to reduce the memory footprint.

It provides a way for simple and routine NSE tasks to be automatically applied and is especially useful for data that is infrequently queried. These changes allow for a more efficient use of the NSE Advisor and gives you more control.

 

User Management and Security Administration

Support of JWT and X.509 Authentication

There is now more flexibility in the way you securely connect to your managed SAP HANA database with the new support for additional modern authentication methods. You can now sign in with JWT Single Sign-on (SSO), a JWT token or using an X.509 certificate in addition to the previous username and password method. To support these changes, an updated credential dialog with the three options makes it easy to select your desired authentication method. For the JWT Token, you can either use the enabled JWT SSO or use a different JWT token.

To provide clarity, the cockpit interface will always let you know of your current signed in authentication method for each database instance. You are always able to choose a new authentication method for that instance as well, by clicking on â€œChoose Authenticationâ€.

 

String of Valid Origins when Configuring SSO

In SAP HANA Cockpit Manager, when an administrator enables JWT SSO for an SAP HANA database, they will see a new, optional field in the configuration dialog. This provides an additional option for enhanced security by specifying a list of trusted identity providers (IdPs) from where the authentication token will be accepted. With this new feature, you can enforce a policy so only users who have authenticated to the cockpit through a specific identify provider can use SSO to access the SAP HANA database.

 

Conclusion

We hope this blog post has given you a helpful overview of the key new functionality released in SAP HANA cockpit SP 18. With enhancements in administration and monitoring, landscape management, advanced administration and security & user management, we hope that you can leverage these new functionalities in your daily operational activities. For further information on all new features, please visit the Whatâ€™s New in the SAP HANA Cockpit 2.0 section of the SAP Help Portal. You can visit the SAP help portal for more information about the SAP HANA cockpit.

entry.title: Re: DASHBOARD - PENDING FOR APPROVAL PR & PO
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

We have checked and can confirm that the following KBAs are related to your requirement for displaying pending approvals and approver details for PRs and POs:

  • KBA 3213204 â€“ Explains how to extract workflow approval data for Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, and Supplier Invoices using CDS views (I_WorkflowStatusOverview, I_WorkflowStatusDetails, I_WorkflowRecipients_V2) and link them with PR/PO tables for reporting.

  • KBA 3633035 â€“ Provides steps to create a custom analytical report or Fiori app to display the list of PRs pending approval along with approver details by using Custom CDS Views and Analytical Queries.

Both KBAs complement each other:
KBA 3213204 covers the technical data extraction for workflows, while 3633035 guides on how to build and expose the custom app or report for end users.

We recommend following both KBAs together to fulfill your dashboard/reporting requirement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

References:
3213204 - Workflow data details for Purchase Orders, Purchase Requisitions, Supplier Invoice
3633035 - App to Display List of Approvers for Purchase Requisitions in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

I hope this helps.

 

Regards

Aishwarya

entry.title: Re: DS Designer 4.3 SP03 PL8 does not connect
entry.content:
OK, I did it!
The problem is that to connect with Designer, you MUST BE ABLE TO RESOLVE the IP address of the server into a hostname.
DNS or the HOSTS FILE are fine, but the client PC must be able to do it.
If a DNS is not available, YOU MUST put an entry in file hosts. AFTER you've populated your hosts file, you'll be able to log in to Designer, EVEN via IP.

entry.title: Maximize the value of HR data â€“ Introducing People Intelligence
entry.content:
We are excited to introduce people Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud â€“ People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud is the new People Analytics solution from SAP based on the fully managed Business Data Cloud that unifies and governs data from SAP SuccessFactors, other SAP and non-SAP sources while preserving its original business context to enable analytics. Designed for HR leaders, HR Business Partners, Managers and many other personas, the solution helps answer some of the most important and critical business questions through prebuilt insight applications.

 The problem

Data is the new currency and HR data has even more potential but, the reality is that most of this data remains fragmented, scattered across silos, locked in incompatible formats, or inaccessible in real time. This fragmentation hinders agility, quick decision-making, and slows innovation. As HR landscapes evolve rapidly and competition intensifies, companies need more than just access to dataâ€”they need clarity, coherence, and the ability to act on insights with confidence and speed. Additional complexities arise when we want to make this data available for powering AI scenarios and enriching the data leveraging machine learning and Data Science capabilities.

Our solution

To address these data silos and solve these business challenges faced by HR Leaders, weâ€™re introducing People Intelligence â€“ A solution that transforms people, skills, Learning, Recruiting, and talent data into actionable, AI-driven insights. It is a collection of insight Applications around SuccessFactors Core HR, Skills, Recruiting, Learning and talent modules. Many of these insight apps have been built to showcase broad spectrum of insights from these modules and many more to be added covering the other modules as per the published roadmap.

Some of the key Insights that HR leaders can derive through people Intelligence are -

  • Talent Flow Analytics,
  • Knowing if they are building Skills led future-ready organization?
  • Our investments in learning are improve skills proficiencies and how does it impact employee performance?
  • Are we paying performance and how is our ethnicity and gender pay gap?

 People Intelligence is built on SAP Business Data Cloud(BDC)

As stated earlier, BDC is a fully managed Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution designed to unify, govern, and make sense of data across the entire business landscape. It brings together SAP and non-SAP data into one trusted, business-ready foundationâ€”enabling decision-makers access real-time insights with full context. By connecting siloed information through a powerful semantic layer and open data ecosystem, SAP BDC transforms raw data into a strategic asset. BDC brings this powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Business Warehouse, plus managed SAP Databricks, intelligent applications, and data products.

Data Products are curated data sets, the meta data that describes the data set and an API to exchange the data.
Data Products are then used in realising SAP Datasphere Analytic models that power SAP Analytic Cloud stories or Planning scenarios.
Each insight App that is part of People Intelligence is based on SAP curated semantic models, which provide customers with tailored insights and actionable recommendations out-of-the-box.

List of Insight Apps delivered as part of People Intelligence GA:

  • Workforce composition Insight App: Visualize workforce composition by role, location, demographics, and org structure, and track how talent flows through the organization by analysing movements, new-hires and terminations data.
  • Skills Insight App: See current employee skills, identify role-level gaps (as-is vs. required proficiency), and track which skills are rising or declining across the organization.
  • Workforce Compensation(EC based) Insight App: Gain clear compensation visibility by viewing average salaries by role, grade, and location, analysing compa-ratio organization-wide, and comparing pay for terminated employees versus new hires.
  • Recruiting Insight App: Reduce time-to-hire and recruitment costs by uncovering the most effective talent sources and ensuring project success by filling open positions faster.
  • Learning Insight App: Drive agility across your teams through targeted trainings that closes essential Skills and Proficiency gaps.
  • Performance Insight App: Drive productivity and fairness by connecting performance trends to compensation, promotion rate and turnover outcomes.
  • Goals Insight App: Ensure goal-setting aligns with organizational strategy and includes progress tracking to completion.
  • Succession Insight App: Build a stronger leadership pipeline by evaluating successor readiness, uncovering risk areas, by refining talent pool readiness and succession strategies.
  • Career Development Planning(CDP) Insight App: Enhance retention and engagement through tailored, actionable insights into employee development goals.

Through all of these Insight Apps we have enabled access to Data Analyzer which helps the user with a predefined ready-to-run service for multidimensional, pivot styled ad-hoc analysis using our Datasphere models directly.

Another notable feature that is made available in all of the Insight Apps is a A/B comparison utility which helps compare key measure values like headcount etc., by bringing them side by side and by selecting dimensions like location, organization unit, job classification etc., This helps the persona discover the headcount changes between the two locations or by the other selected dimensions in an intuitive manner.

People Intelligence â€“ Product Capabilities:

  • Access semantically rich Data Products across all SuccessFactors Modules provided by a scalable SAP managed Data Lake.
  • Access to cross SAP Data Products comprising harmonized data across SAP LOBs discoverable via the central data product catalog.
  • Integrate Data from non-SAP systems into Business Data Cloud.
  • Utilize ready to run insights with out-of-the-box analytical models and dashboards for SuccessFactors modules and cross LOB use-cases.
  • Leverage the power of SAP Business Data Cloud stack to extend the pre-delivered content or create your own analytical application.
  • Enable your data engineers and data scientists to perform pro-code data engineering, data science, custom AI/ML and advanced analytics use-cases.
  • Close the action to insight gap by bringing analytics into the flow of your users in SuccessFactors via Joule.

In summary, People Intelligence helps Drive better HR and business performance with proactively delivered, AI-driven insights and help them stay ahead by continually adapting and optimizing with agility.

Whatâ€™s Next

Watch this space for separate blog posts to cover the various insight Apps that we are delivering as part of People Intelligence, the business questions they answer etc.,

Please check the official BDC Roadmap for a comprehensive overview of forthcoming features not just as part of People Intelligence but also BDC.

Resources to know more about People Intelligence:

  • Know more about SAP Business Data Cloud
  • Watch our Success Connect solution deep dive (registration required).
  • Register for our upcoming webinars on People Intelligence: "Drive Better Workforce Decisions with a New Approach to People Analytics" 
  • Visit our Website to know more: https://www.sap.com/people-intelligence
  • Know the potential of People Analytics: IDC Paper: "How AI-Driven Workforce Insights Unlock Value in the Talent Practice for HR Leaders"

entry.title: EntraID Token Propagation via SAP Approuter for Azure destinations?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

My question is related to an integration case, where I want to privately integrate data from a SAP backend to an Azure Storage account.

Situation: Write Data from the backend (S/4) via Integration Suite to a private Storage account. I am using SAP private link service (PLS) to be able to reach the private endpoint of the azure storage account, the destination call must be made via an SAP approuter, as there is no direct way of calling the PLS destination directly in SAP Integration Suite.

Problem: Even though the approuter supports token propagation, i could not figure out a way of chaining the propagation, so that I authenticate at the Approuter protected by Cloud IAS (with MS Entra as corp. IdP), translate the token to back to the correct format, that is then presented to the Storage account. The issue lies in the audience claim of the JWT token. For authenticating against the storage account the scope has to match the targeted azure resource (https://storage.azure.com in this case), the claim required by the approuter, however, is the client id of the Cloud IAS application. 

Question(s): Is this integration case even supported by SAP Cloud IAS / MS Entra Token Propagation in combination with using the SAP approuter? My assumption was, since all resources are protected by the same Entra Id tenant, it must be possible to propagate/translate the token to the respective resources?

Another interesting questions would be, if there is a planned feature to support Private Link Service directly via Integration Suite instead of the work-around via the approuter?


Thanks a lot in advance for any response. 

Best Regards 
Matthias

entry.title: Use APIM extract variable and then use it in the condition string?
entry.content:
Hello APIM experts...

I am fairly new to APIM and I am trying to extract a variable from JSON input and then use that variable within the API condition strings to send it to the appropriate API path. I have tried looking on the interwebs and have read a bunch of posts and am not having any luck.

Here is my example JSON:

{
  "orderNumber" : "123456789",
...
}

I have tried several variants of the following in my Extract Variables policy:

I want to extract orderNumber into a variable and then if that orderNumber matches a pattern, I want to send it to the Proxy Endpoint in/DEVcreateorder and if it matches a different pattern, I want to send it to in/TESTcreateorder.

So my questions would be:

  1. Is this possible?
  2. If possible, how to extract that value into a variable I can use in the condition string within APIM?

Like I said, I have read and tried things I have read to no avail at even extracting the variable yet. Any help is appreciated!

Thanks for taking the time!

Neal

entry.title: Re: Passing a LIST between Automations
entry.content:
Hi, JesseThibodeau.

You can use a List with parameters created with Any type. The Any type means an Object, including an Array of Objects. When you use the Any type you lost the structure reference for autocomplete. But you can do a LOOP and get the value an specific field. If you try to use a field with wrong name or no exists, on execution result an error.

The other way is create a Data Type with your specific fields and mark it like a List. And when you create the automation parameter select the Data Type created. The bad thing, inside the Workflow Process, you have to mapping all the corresponding fields.

entry.title: Addition to existing stock prevented by source HU-type if not allowed in destination storage type
entry.content:
Hello experts,

during processing of inbound customer returns, we pack the receiving products in plastic bins (1 bin per Product/Batch). The warehouse tasks are created for these HUs with the intention of adding these products to existing stock when possible (without the plastic bin), otherwise an empty storage bin should be targeted (with plastic bin). We use addition to existing stock based on weight/volume, we don't use dimensionless capacities.

The issue we face is, that possible target bins for addition to existing stock are ignored by the system when the HU type of the plastic bin (source HU) is not allowed in that particular storage type for final putaway (although the products are removed from the source HU before adding to the existing destination HU.

I tried several settings in warehouse process type and in the storage type with the intention that the system ignores the source HU-type when using addition to existing stock but did not succeed so far.

Is it somehow possible to configure that the source HU is not considered in putaway when using addition to existing stock and is only considered when an empty bin is found?

Thanks and best regards! WPT and Storage type settings attached.

Joule for consultants is a complete new LLM. Separate instance. Separate tool. Excellent for SAP proprietary content search. 

Martin

entry.title: InnerSource Summit 2025
entry.content:
InnerSource is the practice of applying Open Source methodologies, culture and best practices to in-house software development.
SAP is honored to co-host this year's InnerSource Summit, an hybrid across-the-world event, where practitioners and interested parties come together to learn, share, expand their networks and recharge their InnerSource batteries.

Join the event to learn more about how the practice is adopted by different companies and to connect with industry peers who are also interested in or working with InnerSource.

If you can't join onsite in Berlin, join us virtually or in Yokohama and New York, where the event is co-hosted by Mitsubishi Electric and IBM.

Please register for the event via this link: https://innersourcecommons.org/events/isc-2025/

entry.title: Re: Preparation Cerification SAC
entry.content:
Hi @rouchad_abderrazak1042 - Welcome to world of SAC ğŸ¤—

I will be having the certification exam in mind; sometimes there are more ways to do it, but I will give - what I think - is the correct answer. 

Q1: You have a dimension with members for product groups and products. Each product group has associated products. You want to plan by product group without disaggregating into the products.

How can you do this?

Disable allocations
Use two properties
Disable distribution
Use two hierarchies

A1:  Make two hierarchies, one where you have the product categories as leaf members, and do the planning on that hierarchy, then there will be no disaggregation and another hierarchy with products as leaf members. 

Further elaboration / Info: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/1679129715024574b7bbb4a611471765.html?locale=en-US

_______________________________________________________________________________________________ 

Q2: You are creating a new public version. Which categories can you use?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Forecast
Budget
Predictive
Actual

A2: The correct answer is "Budget" and "Forecast". I think the predictive version, needs to be "generated" (e.g trained) by using the "predictive Scenarios" app in SAC. From a business perspective, at least for me, it does not really make sense to "create" actuals, I think they should always come from a "source" (ECC, S4 etc.)

Not to confuse too much, but if you are in the "modeler", you can also make "Actuals", which I guess is not "Actual" ğŸ˜…. 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________  Q3: You are creating a script for an advanced data action. Which character designates a virtual variable member?

 

%
/
#
.

A3: Virtual variable member(s) are designated by using the "#". You use %parameter% for parameters in SAC. By using two "//" you can comment, using @ for variables (not virtual) - and a "." is simply a dot ğŸ˜„

_______________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Q4: You have a story in My Files. You want your colleague to review and comment on the story. What must you do?

Create a Review task for the story
Add a Comment widget to the story
Include the story in a Discussion
Share with View access

A4: What should be noted here is that the story is in "My Files" - and this is also why I don't like any of the answersğŸ˜…, I think it should be transferred out of my files as a first step, given this is a personal folder.  

So instead, I will try using the method of "what I don't think it is".
I do not think it is the "Add comment widget", because this will not establish a "good" review process, neither will "Share with View Access". By including the story as an attachment and creating a in a discussion you might get half the way, BUT I think the correct answer here is "Create a Review task for the story", given that it will both allow for a governed review process and commenting on the story.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q5: What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns
Load widgets in the background
Avoid prompts
Use responsive pages
Use conditional formatting

A5: Avoid large tables, make widget(s) load in the background, using prompts can be beneficial so we should definitely not avoid them, conditional formatting puts "extra" processing time on the front layer (SAC has 3 layers; backend, network and frontend) and responsive pages should render faster than canvas - I have not  personally experience a big difference here. 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q6:You have a live data model with two dimensions: Firstname and Lastname. Users want a single dimension in the data model that displays the dimensions as Lastname, Firstname.

What must you do?

Create the combined data in the source system data model.
Create a calculated dimension in the story.
Create a dimension in the live data model.
Group the Firstname and Lastname in the data model.

A6: Another one of those questions ğŸ˜…. I will always correct it in the backend (for reusable aspects, performance etc.) , but it is possible to create a calculated dimension in SAC. Below I simply calculated a new Dimension by adding Sales manager + Location.  When we are on "live connection" there is not much (if any) you can do on the model in SAC, so we cannot create a dimension in the live data model. Also, group Firstname and LastName in the data model is also a "no-no senor".

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q7: You have a story based on an import model. The transaction data in the model's data source changes.

How can you update the data in the model?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Refresh the import job
Schedule the import
Allow model import
Refresh the story

A7: When we have an import or acquired model,  nothing will happen in SAC when the source data changes per default unless we have set up an import job in the calendar or by manual refreshing the import job.   

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q8: You have a dataset that extracts data from an SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) system. The data in the SAP BW system changes. How can you update the dataset?

You must refresh the story that uses the dataset.
You must manually reimport the data.
You can schedule the dataset to update on a regular basis.
You must create a new dataset.

A8: I am not strong on datasets. But I just opened one, and you can  reimport it manually from either local system or file server.  

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q9: Which SAP Analytics Cloud feature uses natural language processing?

Smart insight
Data analyzer
Digital boardroom
Just Ask feature

A9: The Just Ask feature; you can ask "questions" to specific (index) model, I have not used it for a long time, but back then they needed to be "indexed". The Data Analyzer is for exploration of data (resembles Pivot in Excel), Digital Boardroom is being outfaced and more a "presentation feature" and "Smart insights" is more of an augmented/statistical analytics feature.

Info:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/c9eb30cc1e5b4c439cb871bf9612d2ac.html?locale=en-US 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q10:  Which automatically created dimension type can you delete from an analytic data model?

Date
Generic
Version
Organization

A10: Note, we have two type of models in SAC : Analytical - and Planning Model.  When you create a model in SAC; the automatically generate dimensions are: Date and Version. 

For Planning models, you will NEED a version dimension - the system allows you to delete it, but you will get an error afterwards. But you can delete "Date" (but note, that a planning model needs at least one dimension other than version).
For an Analytical model, you will also need a version dimension, but you can delete "Date", and the model does not need at least one other dimension than version. 

I hope it helps you on you SAC journey! ğŸ˜Š 

Kind regards,
Dani

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 Speakers' Series: Special SAP Community Moments
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

My name is Moshe Naveh from the SAP community team. Itâ€™s this time of the year when SAP community members come together. Those attending SAP TechEd in person and virtually add another dimension to their online community friendships and bonding. I feel itâ€™s like our virtual family reunion and everyone share where they are at in their life and SAP Community journey.

Therefore, in this blog post I will share about my own community journey that started back in 2009 and still happily continues these days:

  1. My Special SAP Community moments and initiatives
  2. SAP Community members' SAP TechEd sessions
  3. Share your SAP Community special moments, first and recent post and cool picture

Why I wear these ears:) :

My special ears on to show tribute to the Blog It Forward series during SAP TechEd Berlin 2014

 

 My Special SAP Community Moments

1) Community challenges/initiatives 

The community challenges are a great opportunity to get to know other SAP Community members. What they are passionate about, the amazing people they are, places they have been to and more.

Here are some challenges/initiative I ran since I joined the community and gave me great joy:

Blog forward, What do you do?, SAP Sapphire speaker series and the most recent one, our hobbies series. It is so much fun getting to know how creative, diligent, sportive our SAP Community members are:

Featuring of the Hobbies series

  2) My first SAP Inside Track

Back in 2013 I organized the first SAP Inside Track in Israel. We had over than 100 SAP Community members from 40 different companies. The event included 23 sessions, each lasting 15 minutes (which was then innovative). 

Audience at SAP Inside Track 2013 Israel

 

Organizing the event was a complex project: 

  • Identifying the right speakers and working with them to optimize their presentations
  • Inviting and following up with the attendees 
  • Working on all the required logistics: Catering, venue, sound and IT systems and much more

It was so much fun and our dear community members had an amazing time.

3) SAP TechEd events

My first SAP TechEd was in SAP TechEd Bangalore- 2012. I had so much fun! It was my first time in India as well. I was amazed by so many things: the event itself and the innovative booths, the great Indian food, beautiful touristic attractions and above all I was so happy to meet the SAP community members from India and other locations. To suddenly talk, shake hands and even dance with my online friends was a great pleasure. We also had a gathering of the Blog it forward participants and we all celebrated together 10 years of SAP community. 

Jitendra Kansal and I, in SAP TechEd Bangalore 2012

The following SAP TechEd events I attended continued to be unforgettable experiences. Each SAP TechEd event offered itâ€™s own unique spirit and cool SAP Community activities

I'm broadcasting from the SAP TechEd Berlin 2017

4) Simplified blogging

Iâ€™m very fortunate that after almost 16 years as an SAP Community advocate, Iâ€™m still passionate about what I do. One of things I most passionate is to support our dear SAP Community members to make the most out of their SAP Community experience. This is what led me to establish the simplified blogging methodology. 

The idea behind this method is that by using AI tools and predefined templates per event, SAP Community members can reduce the time it takes them to blog by up to 75%. The method was initially trialed at the SAP Sapphire speakersâ€™ series and received positive feedback from the authors/speakers. By keeping our AI guidelines and keep the content unique and with your own voice, you can dramatically reduce the time it takes you to blog. 

Simplified blogging methodology was used in smaller events but also in our current SAP TechEd speakers series (and the recap series where the AI tools usage was introduced). The most recent usage of the simplified blogging methodology is the SAP TechEd Berlin speakers 2025 series which I would like to share with you today. 

Every session by an SAP Community member is a special SAP Community moment. It is where everyone can connect and share knowledge, which is also what our SAP Community is about. In this series our remarkable SAP Community members who speak at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025, shared what they are going to present about. They also invite you to engage and network with them before the event via multiple interesting questions:

 

Title

Author

Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

@sunny_kapoor

entry.title: Empowering Process Visibility with Step Navigation Links
entry.content:
Introduction

In the world of process automation and monitoring, visibility is powerâ€”but actionability is the real game-changer. Thatâ€™s why SAP Process Visibility offers a powerful feature that lets you go beyond viewing process steps to actually interacting with them: Step Navigation Links.

With just one click, users can jump directly from a step in the Process Workspace to the relevant task in the source application [Eg., My Inbox, SAP Task Center etc.,] streamlining issue resolution, approvals, and decision-making.

Letâ€™s explore how easy it is to set this up.

 

What Are Step Navigation Links?

Step navigation links allow you to embed deep links in specific steps of a process path so users can quickly navigate to external apps like My Inbox, SAP Task Center, or any custom application to take action or see more details.

This bridges the gap between process monitoring and process execution.

 

Real-World Example

Imagine you're tracking a Capital Expenditure Approval process in SAP Process Visibility. One of the steps is a pending task that a manager needs to approve in My Inbox.

With Step Navigation Links, you can:

  • Display a clickable link right on the process step in the Process Path view.
  • Direct users to the exact task instance in 'My Inbox'.
  • Eliminate the need for users to search manually or switch between systems.

 

How to Configure Step Navigation Links

A quick step-by-step guide to configure step navigation links in your visibility scenario can be found in our SAP Help Documentation : Configure Step Navigation Links.

 

Example: Deep Linking to My Inbox

Steps:

  • In the visibility scenario editor, navigate to the Processes tab and choose the SAP Build Process Automation process for which you want to configure step navigation link.
  • Under Steps and Events section, select the required step from the list and choose â€œEditâ€.

  • In the Edit Step dialog box, navigate to the Link tab, and enable the Enable Link Configurations toggle button to configure the navigation link and update the Event, Path and Link Text as shown in the below example.

Hereâ€™s a practical example of how to create a dynamic link:

Copy the Original URL from 'My Inbox':

In the copied URL, replace the InstanceID with {stepInstanceId}, which will be dynamically retrieved from Process Visibility

Final URL:

This ensures that the link dynamically pulls the correct step instance ID when viewed in Process Visibility.

 

Why This Matters

Step Navigation Links bring real-time actionability to your process monitoring tools. Instead of just seeing that something is pending, users can click directly into the task, speeding up response times and improving collaboration across teams.

Theyâ€™re especially valuable in scenarios like:

  • Procurement Approvals
  • HR Workflows
  • (Or) Any custom business process.

 

Final Thoughts

Configuring Step Navigation Links in SAP Process Visibility enables a dynamic, interactive experience. Whether you're managing tasks in My Inbox, SAP Task Center, or custom apps, these deep links let you act without leaving your process dashboard.

Itâ€™s a small setup with big impactâ€”boosting productivity, responsiveness, and user satisfaction.

entry.title: Re: What kind of purchase with SAP to get C# .NET connector
entry.content: Connector SDKs like NCo run on the client host. No additional software is required on server side. Hence, I don't think that NCo would be included in any AS ABAP server installation package. You can download NCo separately from https://support.sap.com/nco if your company has the required download permission.

entry.title: How to Read Change Document in MDG Mass Processing
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I am looking for some solution to read change document for plant in Mass Processing MDG because in Mass process based on 1 CR no we have multiple Material with multiple plant.
So how can i fetch material and which plant it is linked to?

from code how we can fetch data for mass if we are using below change 

lo_usmd_chg_doc->read_document_lines(
EXPORTING is_document_header = ls_doc_hdr
io_model = lo_if_model
IMPORTING et_changed_value = lt_cg_doc_vals
et_changed_detail = lt_cg_doc_details ).

Because in lt_cg_doc vals the output for mass process is be like 1st row contain FIELD NAME - MATERIAL & VALUE - MATERIAL NO
2nd ROW contain FIELD NAME - WERKS & VALUE - WERKS NO
So how we can linked 2 rows with each other 

Or do we have some other solution to find out data from Change Document in MDG which plant got change for which Material.
